TEI.2.document_title: Horatio Chriesman to Stephen F. Austin, 11-13-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: Delay in surveying due to sickness.

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Delay in surveying due to sickness.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Dear sir*/p*
*p*I am sorry to inform you that it is out of my power to start *location_mentioned*below*/location_mentioned* as soon as I expected Owing to the ill health of my *p*Family*/p* my *p*Wife*/p* and *p*children*/p* are all unwell but not so much so as *p*Miss Hope*/p* she was taken with the influenza on *date_mentioned n="11-11-1826">Saturday*/date_mentioned* night and has been very bad she appears better this *date_mentioned n="11-13-1826">morning */date_mentioned*I hope I shall be able to get of in three or four days if you cannot wait that long please inform me by the *person_mentioned*Doctr*/person_mentioned* the *person_mentioned*Bearer */person_mentioned*hereof whar I shall meet you I expect I can meet you on *date_mentioned n="11-20-1826">monday*/date_mentioned* next if no unforeseen accident takes place if you should leave before me I wish you to take all the papers relative to your Business—I remain yours with respect*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Hor. Chriesman*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="11-13-1826">Nov. 13. 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* */div1*
